title: negotiations
description: The negotiation process between the broker and the underwriter in order to reach an agreement.
$comment:
The first negotiation is always sent by the belonging broker (A) - another broker (B) from the same team can send the negotiation on behalf of broker (A). A negotiation is very similar to a participation (close to a copy) and is always for one underwriter.

This collection is accessible by brokers and underwriters.

_id.description:
A system-generated unique identifier for a Negotiation, with a format and structure defined by the technology used. As a technical attribute, it has no business meaning.

---

LDM Ref: Negotiation.Negotiation ID

creation_date.description: The date at which the entity was created.

creation_channel.description: Channel used to make the entity, e.g. OutSystems.

creation_user.description: _id of the user creating the entity.

modified_date.description: The date at which the change was made.

modified_channel.description: Channel used to make the change, e.g. OutSystems.

modified_user.description: _id of the user making the change.

access.description: Teams/Users that have access to the negotiation document.

underwriter.description: Extended Reference for an Underwriter User responsible for this Negotiation.

_xid.description:
ID reference to the Underwriter. This reference points to a user in the Users collection.

---

organisation_name.description: Name of the organisation the Underwriter belongs to.

company_name.description: The company name of the user belongs to.

company_xid.description: _id of the company the User belongs to.

sent_by.description: Sub-Document that is an Extended Reference to the User responsible for sending the Negotiation.

_xid.description: Reference to the Users collection. This reference stores the User responsible for sending the Negotiation.

first_name.description: The First Name of the User responsible for sending the Negotiation.

last_name.description: The Last Name of the User responsible for sending the Negotiation.

organisation_name.description: The name of the Organisation the User responsible for sending the Negotiation belongs.

company_name.description: The company name of the user belongs to.

company_xid.description: The company xid of the user belongs to.

broker.description:
The user information who is performing some action within a certain context. 

This is normally either a broker OR an underwriter.

_xid.description: _id field of the user in the users collection.

organisation_name.description:
Name of the organisation the user belongs to. 
Removes need for lookup when showing brokers and underwriters info under other collections context.

company_name.description:
The company name of the user belongs to.
Removes need for lookup when showing brokers and underwriters info under other collections context.

placement.description:
Reference to the Placement in the Placements collection. This Placement holds the Section that is being Negotiated in this Negotiation/Participation.

Improves performance on queries.

submission.description: Reference to the Submission sent by the Broker to the Underwriter. With this Submission a Participation and the Negotiation process started.

contract.description: Reference to the Contract ID. This Contract holds the Section that is being negotiated. The Contract ID is stored in a Placement document sub-structure.

section.description:
The ID of the section that is associated with the negotiation. This Section is being negotiated by the Broker and the Underwriter.

---

participation.description:
The ID of the participation that is associated with the negotiation.

---

LDM Ref: Negotiation.Participation ID

written_line_basis.description:
**Reference Data**

The basis on which the underwriter's written lines are applied to the order or contract.
  
For example percentage of whole, percentage of order, part of whole, part of order.

LineBasisType in Reference Data

---

LDM Ref: Binding Information.Written Line Basis

previous.description: Reference to the previous Negotiation exchanged between the Broker and Underwriter in the negotiation process.

proposed.description: Sub-Document that holds all the values proposed by the Broker to the Underwriter.

line_percentage_min.description:
The minimum percentage of a risk that the broker is proposing the underwriter accepts on behalf of the members of the syndicate or company for which they underwrite.

---

LDM Ref: Participation.Proposed Min Written Line Percentage

line_percentage_max.description:
The maximum percentage of a risk that the broker is proposing the underwriter accepts on behalf of the members of the syndicate or company for which they underwrite.

---

LDM Ref: Participation.Proposed Mac Written Line Percentage

line_percentage.description:
The percentage of a risk that the broker is proposing the underwriter accepts on behalf of the members of the syndicate or company for which they underwrite. This is commonly expressed as a percentage of the sum insured. If, on completion of the broking exercise, the written lines exceed 100% then they will be signed down by the broker (reduced proportionately so that they total 100%).

---

LDM Ref: Participation.Proposed Written Line Percentage

amount_min.description:
The minimum monetary amount of a risk that the broker is proposing the underwriter accepts on behalf of the members of the syndicate or company for which they underwrite.

---

LDM Ref: Participation.Proposed Min Written Amount

amount_max.description:
The maximum monetary amount of a risk that the broker is proposing the underwriter accepts on behalf of the members of the syndicate or company for which they underwrite.

---

LDM Ref: Participation.Proposed Max Written Amount

amount.description:
The amount of a risk that the broker is proposing the underwriter accepts on behalf of the members of the syndicate or company for which they underwrite.

---

LDM Ref: Participation.Proposed Written Amount

currency_code.description:
**Reference Data**

The alphabetic code that represents the currency in the ISO 4217 standard.

Currency in Reference Data

--- 

LDM Ref: Participation.Proposed Written Currency Code

value.description:
The percentage of a risk that an underwriter is willing to accept on behalf of the members of the syndicate or company for which they underwrite. This is commonly expressed as a percentage of the sum insured. If, on completion of the broking exercise, the written lines exceed 100% then they will be signed down by the broker (reduced proportionately so that they total 100%).

---

LDM Ref: Participation.Written Line Percentage

items.description:
Details on the comments exchanged between broker and underwriter during the contract placing process.

---

LDM Ref: Comment (Negotiation)

datetime.description:
The date and time at which the comment was made.

---

LDM Ref: Comment (Negotiation).Comment Datetime

message.description:
The content of the comment.

---

LDM Ref: Comment (Negotiation).Comment

_xid.description: _id of the Document to which we are referencing.

name.description:
The file name of the document including the extension.

---

LDM Ref: Document.Document File Name

title.description:
The title of the comment.

---

Its used by API Team

type.description:
To group comments i.e. in the case of the multiple subjectivity flows 

---

Its used by API Team

NegotiationStatus in Reference Data

---

line_percentage.description:
The percentage of a risk that a broker is calculating in the UI for the underwriter to accept on behalf of the members of the syndicate or company for which they underwrite.

---

LDM Ref: Participation.Calculated Line Percentage

is_manual_value.description: Flag to identify manual values for the calculated field.

is_on_calculated_process.description:
Indicates that the calculated line is locked in the UI.

Default value set to false.

When "calculate" and "save" - the value is set to true.

When "sign & close" - the value returns false again

---

LDM Ref: Participation.Calculated Line Locked Indicator

is_edit_mode_calculated.description: Boolean with True if the calculated values were calculated inside the Declaration Edit Mode and False by default.

line_percentage.description:
The percentage of a risk that an underwriter has agreed to accept. It may be the same as the underwriter’s written line or a lower amount if there is signing down.

---

LDM Ref: Participation.Signed Line Percentage

amount.description:
The amount of a given risk that an underwriter has agreed to accept. It may be the same as the underwriter’s written line or a lower amount if there is signing down.

---

LDM Ref: Participation.Signed Amount

settlement.description:
Settlement information specific to the section.

---

LDM Ref: Settlement Information

year_of_account.description:
A breakdown of the premium by year of account, required on risks where the contract period exceeds 18 months.

---

LDM Ref: Settlement Information.Year of Account

due_date.description:
The date and time by which the insurers wish to receive their premium.

---

LDM Ref: Settlement Information.Settlement Due Datetime

instalment_credit_period_days.description:
The number of days added to the client due dates of subsequent instalments.

---

LDM Ref: Settlement Information.Instalment Credit Period Days

adjustment_credit_period_days.description:
The number of days after the date(s) specified for the provision of adjustments that insurers expect the final adjustment(s) of premium (if any) to be paid.

---

LDM Ref: Settlement Information.Adjustment Credit Period Days

stamps.description:
A mapping between Participation and Underwriter Stamp. This allows an underwriter to split their participation into multiple stamps.

---

LDM Ref: Participation Stamp

name.description:
The name of the stamp. This usually reflects the wet stamp and will be based on the syndicate number for Lloyd's syndicates, or entered by the broker or underwriter in the PPL platform.
 
For example "ABC1234", "ABC Consortium 9999", "ABC B12345678987654 2019 Energy Facility - ABC 1234 (25.25%) DEF 5678 (50.00%) GHI 8101 (24.75%). Premium/claims settled direct with ABC"

---

LDM Ref: Stamp.Stamp Name

written_line_percentage.description:
The percentage of a risk that an underwriter is willing to accept on behalf of the members of the syndicate or company for which they underwrite. This is commonly expressed as a percentage of the sum insured. If, on completion of the broking exercise, the written lines exceed 100% then they will be signed down by the broker (reduced proportionately so that they total 100%).

---

LDM Ref: Participation Stamp.Written Line Percentage

written_line_amount.description:
The amount of a risk that an underwriter is willing to accept on behalf of the members of the syndicate or company for which they underwrite.

---

Participation Stamp.Written Amount

written_line_currency_code.description:
**Reference data**

The alphabetic code that represents the currency in the ISO 4217 standard.

---

LDM Ref: Participation Stamp.Written Currency Code

calculated_line_percentage.description:
The percentage of a risk that a broker is calculating in the UI for the underwriter to accept on behalf of the members of the syndicate or company for which they underwrite.

LDM Ref: N/A

signed_line_percentage.description:
The percentage of a risk that an underwriter has agreed to accept. It may be the same as the underwriter’s written line or a lower amount if there is signing down.

LDM Ref: Participation Stamp.Signed Line Percentage

line_conditions.description:
A mapping between Participation Stamp and Line Condition. Each carrier has their own list of line conditions which an underwriter can select from and apply to a stamp's participation.

---

LDM Ref: Participation Line Condition

description.description:
A description of the line condition.

---

LDM Ref: Line Condition.Line Condition Description

code.description:
Codes:
agreement_party_to_all_claims
agreement_party_to_all_endorsements
line_to_stand

Agreement Party for all Endorsements

agency_code.description:
Agency code will be determined from the stamp collection on the initial lookup of this model.

---

Its used by API Team

stamp_role.description: Backend field. When we assign a role via the Assign Roles functionality at the Placement side, we need to populate this Stamp Role field with the Contractual Role type e.g. Lloyds Leader.

permission_type.description:
The code that represents the permitted territory type.

---

LDM Ref: Section.Stamp Permission Type Code

calculation_decimal_places.description:
Calculation Decimal Places should default to 7 in cases where calculations have not been previously performed.

---

Its used by API Team

type.description: Holds the type of participation (firm_order, endorsement, correction)

sub_type.description:
**Reference Data**

Submission Pack Sub Type Code

---

LDM Ref: Submission Pack Sub Type Code

-- Examples

cancel_and_replace

cancel_contract

cancel_line

panel_amendment

expression_of_interest

follow_quote

for_information_only

lead_quote

facility_lead_quote

facility_follow_quote

status.description:
**Reference data**

The status of the participation.
 
For example Request for Line, Request for Negotiation, Decline Line, Unconditional Acceptance, Conditional Acceptance, Conditions Accepted, Signed Line, Cancelled etc.

ParticipationStatus in Reference Data.

---

LDM Ref: Participation.Participation Status Code

status_reason.description:
**Reference data**

Reasons that are associated with a specific participation status.

StatusReason in Reference Data

---

LDM Ref: Participation.Status Reason Code

last_sent_status.description:
line_conditions keeps track the state of the items in the latest version of a participation

---

Only used by APIs

subjectivities.description:
Requirements which must be met (e.g. produce a survey report in 90 days) or maintained (e.g. fire sprinklers must be active at all times) before the insurer will agree to provide cover under the terms of the section of the insurance contract.

---

LDM Ref: Subjectivity

items.description:
Requirements which must be met (e.g. produce a survey report in 90 days) or maintained (e.g. fire sprinklers must be active at all times) before the insurer will agree to provide cover under the terms of the section of the insurance contract.

---

LDM Ref: Subjectivity

_id.description:
A system-generated unique identifier for a Subjectivity, with a format and structure defined by the technology used. As a technical attribute, it has no business meaning.

---

LDM Ref: Subjectivity.Subjectivity ID

description.description:
A description of the subjectivity and any associated terms. It will include the following details:
- the condition/action that needs to occur, by whom and to what standard
- the applicable timescale, if any, within which the condition is to be met

---

LDM Ref: Subjectivity.Subjectivity Description
examples: Agree all claims by deadline date 12:00 (GMT) 2020-06-01

confirmation_required.description:
Indicates that the subjectivity requires confirmation, and therefore a Deadline, when True.
 
For example producing a survey report in 90 days has a True Confirmation Required Indicator and ensuring fire sprinklers are active at all times has a False Confirmation Required Indicator.

---

LDM Ref: Subjectivity.Confirmation Required Indicator

deadline.description:
The date and time by which the details in the Subjectivity Description attribute need to be met, otherwise consequences apply.

---

LDM Ref: Subjectivity.Subjectivity Deadline Datetime

withdrawn.description:
The date and time on which the subjectivity was withdrawn.

---

LDM Ref: Subjectivity.Subjectivity Withdrawn Datetime

off_cover.description:
Indicates that the participant wishes to be off cover until the subjectivities have been met when True.

---

LDM Ref: Subjectivity.Off Cover Indicator

subjectivity_status.description:
**Reference data**

The status of the subjectivity.
 
For example To do, Satisfied, Expired, Pending, Deleted.

SubjectivityStatus in Reference Data

---

LDM Ref: Subjectivity Status.Subjectivity Status Code

negotiation_status.description:
**Reference data**

The status of the negotiation.

NegotiationStatus in Reference Data

---

LDM Ref: Negotiation Status.Negotiation Status Code

satisfaction_attempt.description: Attempts to satisfy a given subjectivity.

status.description:
**Reference data:**

The status of the satisfaction attempt.

---

LDM Ref: Satisfaction Attempt Status. Satisfaction Attempt Status Code

datetime.description: Date when the satisfaction attempt was made.

user.description:
The user information who is performing some action within a certain context. 

This is normally either a broker OR an underwriter.

_xid.description: _id field of the user in the users collection.

organisation_name.description:
Name of the organisation the user belongs to. 
Removes need for lookup when showing brokers and underwriters info under other collections context.

company_name.description:
The company name of the user belongs to.
Removes need for lookup when showing brokers and underwriters info under other collections context.

sent.description: If the satisfaction attempt was sent or not.

items.description:
This document structure is specific for subjectivities' satisfaction attempts.

Each satisfaction attempt's document has a broker and an underwriter version. Both documents are similar, have the same name and are sent at the same time, because in practice they are the same document. Although, they are stored as different documents, one for broker and the other for underwriter.

broker_xid.description: All satisfaction attempts documents had a broker and an underwriter version. This field is the _id of the Document to which we are referencing (broker document).

underwriter_xid.description: All satisfaction attempts documents had a broker and an underwriter version. This field is the _id of the Document to which we are referencing (underwriter document).

name.description:
The file name of the document including the extension.

---

LDM Ref: Document.Document File Name

sent.description: This field holds the information of whether or not the document was already sent.

sent_datetime.description: If the document was sent, this field holds the information of the date that the document was sent.

saved_as_accepted.description: When the subjectivity is saved as draft, the accepted/declined checkbox state should be stored. This boolean saves the "accepted" state.

saved_as_declined.description: When the subjectivity is saved as draft, the accepted/declined checkbox state should be stored. This boolean saves the "declined" state.

Automated comment happen when, for instance, request is rejected that caused the role to be rejected automatically.

sub_panel.description:
The group of carriers on the contract.

---

LDM Ref: Sub-panel

_xid.description:
A system-generated unique identifier for a Sub-panel, with a format and structure defined by the technology used. As a technical attribute, it has no business meaning.

Points to the ID field of the sub_panel in the Participations collection.

---

LDM Ref: Sub-panel.Sub-panel ID

name.description:
The name used to identify the sub-panel.

---

LDM Ref: Sub-panel.Sub-panel Name

sequence_number.description:
The sequence number in which the participations should be displayed in the UI.

---

LDM Ref: Sub-panel.Sub-panel Sequence Number

_xid.description: _id of the Document to which we are referencing.

name.description:
The file name of the document including the extension.

---

LDM Ref: Document.Document File Name

sequence_number.description:
The sequence number that defines the order in which the participations should be displayed in the UI.

---

LDM Ref: Participation.Participation Sequence Number

approval.description: Array to store the approval flow, including requesters and approvers.
approval.$comment: First entry will have the information of the requester, and the second entry is created at the same time with information from the approver. Once the approver takes an action, the status is changed (refer to status field description), and if another action is needed from the requester, a new entry is created, with information from the requester, who can withdrawl the approval process, or again send it to the same approver or a new one.

_xid.description: _id field of the user in the users collection.

sent_date.description: The date that the request or approval response was sent.

message.description: Message sent by the user to include in the approval flow.

status.description:
Action performed by the user. 

		 R - Requested
		 R - Pending Request
		 R - Withdrawn
		 A - Pending Approval
		 A - Approved
		 A - Rejected

in_approval.description: Flag to determine if this negotiation is in 2nd approval

personal_message.description:
A personalised message for one underwriter to accompany the submission, in addition to the general message on the submission pack.

LDM 1.18

order.description:
Order should default to 0.0 (decimal value) in cases where calculations have not been previously performed.

---

Its used by API Team

calculation_decimal_places.description:
Calculation Decimal Places should default to 7 in cases where calculations have not been previously performed.

---

Its used by API Team

limit.description:
Monetary Validations:

- Written Line Total = Greater or Equal to Limit
- Calculated Column = Less or Equal to Written Line Divided by Limit
- Calculated Column = Less or Equal to Written Line Divided by Limit multiplied by the Order

signed_line_basis.description:
**Reference Data**

The basis on which the underwriter's signed lines are applied to the order or contract.
 
For example percentage of whole, percentage of order, part of whole, part of order.

---

LDM Ref: Participation.Calculated Line Percentage

is_manual_value.description: Flag to identify manual values for the calculated field.

is_on_calculate_process.description:
Default value set to false.

When "calculate" and "save" - the value is set to true.

When "sign & close" - the value returns false again

line_percentage.description:
The percentage of a risk that an underwriter has agreed to accept. It may be the same as the underwriter’s written line or a lower amount if there is signing down.

---

amount.description:
The amount of a given risk that an underwriter has agreed to accept. It may be the same as the underwriter’s written line or a lower amount if there is signing down.

line_percentage_min.description:

line_percentage_max.description:
The maximum percentage of a risk that the broker is proposing the underwriter accepts on behalf of the members of the syndicate or company for which they underwrite.

---

LDM Ref: Participation.Proposed Mac Written Line Percentage

line_percentage.description:
The percentage of a risk that the broker is proposing the underwriter accepts on behalf of the members of the syndicate or company for which they underwrite. This is commonly expressed as a percentage of the sum insured. If, on completion of the broking exercise, the written lines exceed 100% then they will be signed down by the broker (reduced proportionately so that they total 100%).

---

LDM Ref: Participation.Proposed Written Line Percentage

amount_min.description:
The minimum monetary amount of a risk that the broker is proposing the underwriter accepts on behalf of the members of the syndicate or company for which they underwrite.

---

LDM Ref: Participation.Proposed Min Written Amount

amount_max.description:
The maximum monetary amount of a risk that the broker is proposing the underwriter accepts on behalf of the members of the syndicate or company for which they underwrite.

---

LDM Ref: Participation.Proposed Max Written Amount

amount.description:
The amount of a risk that the broker is proposing the underwriter accepts on behalf of the members of the syndicate or company for which they underwrite.

---

LDM Ref: Proposed Written Amount

*** Reference data **

locking.description: This object saves the information of the broker that locked the page related to the underwriter tab

contract_version.description:
The technical version number of the contract.
 
For example- 1, 2, 3

---

LDM Ref: Contract.Contract Version ID

is_saved_as_draft.description:
Boolean field to check if the negotiation is saved as a draft or not.

It should always be false after the negotiation is sent.

save_response.description: Sub-document that stores the user responsible for saving the negotiation and the timestamp when the saving occurs.

user.description: Sub-Document that is an Extended Reference to the User responsible for saving the Negotiation.

_xid.description: Reference to the Users collection. This reference stores the User responsible for saving the Negotiation.

first_name.description: The First Name of the User responsible for saving the Negotiation.

last_name.description: The Last Name of the User responsible for saving the Negotiation.

organisation_name.description: The name of the Organisation the User responsible for saving the Negotiation belongs.

company_name.description: The company name of the user belongs to.

datetime.description: The datetime of the user responsible for saving the Negotiation.

first_responding_uw.description:
Extended Reference for an Underwriter User that was Negotiating with the Broker by the time the Negotiation was set to Bound.

This field was created to support PNG-77097, since when a reassignment occurs all the Underwriter references switch to the new Underwriter.

_xid.description:
ID reference to the Underwriter. This reference points to a user in the Users collection.

---

organisation_name.description: Name of the organisation the Underwriter belongs to.

company_name.description: The company name of the user belongs to.

company_xid.description: _id of the company the User belongs to.

is_first_add_info_neg.description: True if this negotiation is the first negotiation of a submission of type additional information.

parent_participations.description:
Contains a list of participation xid’s that were used to create the participation record this negotiation belongs to. The identified participations will be used for validation purposes.
Only negotiations that belong to endorsement participations will contain this array of _xid's.

agreed_date.description: This field marks the date when the negotiation was agreed.
